page.title: 04RAIL TRANSPORT
page.content:
The railway line through Cudworth was part of the{Midland Railway's}Scottish route. At one time the{station}was the only one for Barnsley and had 7 platforms and many sidings holding hundreds of{coal}wagons.
Today the station is in ruins but the signal box and some of the{buildings remain; the platforms have gone. We saw that the bricks were laid in the Flemish Bond pattern.
Everything is covered in weeds and few trains pass on the line; the only ones we see regularly are those that take sand every morning to Redfearn's glassworks.
